PropertySetDef.Name: Pset_CableSegmentTypeCableSegment
PropertySetDef.Definition: Definition from IAI: Electrical cable with a specific purpose to lead electric current within a circuit or any other electric construction. Includes all types of electric cables, mainly several electrical segments wrapped together, e.g. cable, tube, busbar. Note that the number of conductors within a cable is determined by an aggregation mechanism that aggregates the conductors within the cable.

PropertyDef.Name: CrossSectionalArea
PropertyDef.Definition: Cross section area of the cable

PropertyDef.Name: NominalLength
PropertyDef.Definition: The nominal length of a cable, busbar or tube.

PropertyDef.Name: NominalWidthOrDiameter
PropertyDef.Definition: The nominal width of a cable, busbar or tube or, in the case of a circular cross section, the diameter. Note that this value may be used for larger sized cables whose dimensions are explicitly given.

PropertyDef.Name: NominalHeight
PropertyDef.Definition: The nominal height of a cable, busbar or tube or, in the case of a circular cross section, the height is not asserted. Note that this value may be used for larger sized cables whose dimensions are explicitly given.

PropertyDef.Name: NormalOperatingTemperature
PropertyDef.Definition: Normal operating temperature for the cable, busbar.

PropertyDef.Name: MaxOperatingTemperature
PropertyDef.Definition: Maximum operating temperature for the cable.

PropertyDef.Name: CableInsulationMaterial
PropertyDef.Definition: The material from which the insulation is constructed. Such as PVC, PEX, EPR,...
